gitHubText:
## Description

Using a non-numeric user and group ID in Dockerfile makes it harder to configure in K8s since it's not possible to detect if it's a root or non-root.

So we need to make that change to remove explicit config related to the user and group ID. 

**Please note that:**
- This change should be part of 8.4 and **NOT** part of 8.3.x release.
- I've also changed the GID to be the same as the UID (no particular need to have them different).
- This could be marked as a potential breaking change (it doesn't affect the app itself but the operational side like K8s).

## Related issues

Related to: https://github.com/camunda/distribution/issues/122

 aabouzaid: I added a small follow-up here:
https://github.com/camunda/operate/commit/09557e3e9d42eadeaf086e780eaffb0a97e8083a and https://github.com/camunda/operate/commit/51dccaf4f76eec2ab735a1e85d5c987bf4da1d9a

gitHubText:
Bumps [com.amazonaws:aws-java-sdk-sts](https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-java) from 1.12.590 to 1.12.591.
Changelog

Sourced from com.amazonaws:aws-java-sdk-sts's changelog.

1.12.591 2023-11-16

AWS Elemental MediaPackage

  • Features

    • DRM_TOP_LEVEL_COMPACT allows placing content protection elements at the MPD level and referenced at the AdaptationSet level

AWS Glue

  • Features

    • Introduces new column statistics APIs to support statistics generation for tables within the Glue Data Catalog.

AWS IoT

  • Features

    • GA release the ability to index and search devices based on their GeoLocation data. With GeoQueries you can narrow your search to retrieve devices located in the desired geographic boundary.

AWS Lambda

  • Features

    • Adds support for logging configuration in Lambda Functions. Customers will have more control how their function logs are captured and to which cloud watch log group they are delivered also.

AWS Single Sign-On Admin

  • Features

    • Instances bound to a single AWS account, API operations for managing instances and applications, and assignments to applications are now supported. Trusted identity propagation is also supported, with new API operations for managing trusted token issuers and application grants and scopes.

AWS Systems Manager Incident Manager

  • Features

    • Introduces new APIs ListIncidentFindings and BatchGetIncidentFindings to use findings related to an incident.

AWS Transfer Family

  • Features

    • Introduced S3StorageOptions for servers to enable directory listing optimizations and added Type fields to logical directory mappings.

Amazon CodeCatalyst

  • Features

    • This release includes updates to the Dev Environment APIs to include an optional vpcConnectionName parameter that supports using Dev Environments with Amazon VPC.

Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager

  • Features

    • This release adds support for Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager default policies for EBS snapshots and EBS-backed AMIs.

Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud

  • Features

    • Enable use of tenant-specific PublicSigningKeyUrl from device trust providers and onboard jumpcloud as a new device trust provider.

Amazon FSx

  • Features

    • Enables customers to update their PerUnitStorageThroughput on their Lustre file systems.

Amazon Interactive Video Service RealTime

  • Features

    • This release introduces server side composition and recording for stages.

Amazon Macie 2

- [ ] Unit/integration tests are written, that verify all acceptance criteria of the issue
- [ ] E2E tests are written, if the acceptance criteria can't be covered in unit/integration tests
- [ ] The fix/feature is tested manually by the reviewer

Some additional [review guidelines](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/wiki/Pull-Requests-and-Code-Reviews#code-review-guidelines).


 matt-whiteman: Yup I'll rename all the tests later. The try/catch is tricky because all the calls go through a lambda and it won't let me just allow the exception to be thrown since it's an explicit checked exception. I'll look into this when I clean up the individual tests during the DAO implementation
title: test(backend): replace RestHighLevelClient with TestSearchRepository in DAO integration tests

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action (EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action)</summary>

### [`v2.11.0`](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/releases/tag/v2.11.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/compare/v2.10.0...v2.11.0)

Adds the following features:

-   Reduce output from `action_fail` ([#​511](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/issues/511))
-   Support running as ARM images ([#​512](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/issues/512), [#​513](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/issues/513), [#​514](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/issues/514))
-   Use virtualenv in composite action to isolate package installation ([#​501](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/issues/501))
-   Update urllib3 and charset-normalizer dependencies ([#​507](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/issues/507))

### [`v2.10.0`](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/releases/tag/v2.10.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/compare/v2.9.0...v2.10.0)

Adds the following features:

-   Allow for adding or removing test file path prefix ([#​495](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/issues/495))
-   Support for Windows with Python 3.11, and macOS 13 by upgrading lxml from 4.9.1 to 4.9.3 ([#​387](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/issues/387))

### [`v2.9.0`](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/releases/tag/v2.9.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/compare/v2.8.0...v2.9.0)

Adds the following features:

-   Upgrade PyGithub dependency
-   Move to PyGithub implementation of retry and throttling logic ([#​469](https://togithub.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/issues/469))

</details>

gitHubText:
Bumps [com.amazonaws:aws-java-sdk-sts](https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-java) from 1.12.589 to 1.12.590.
Changelog

Sourced from com.amazonaws:aws-java-sdk-sts's changelog.

1.12.590 2023-11-15

AWS CloudTrail

  • Features

    • The Lake Repricing feature lets customers configure a BillingMode for an event data store. The BillingMode determines the cost for ingesting and storing events and the default and maximum retention period for the event data store.

AWS Lambda

  • Features

    • Add Java 21 (java21) support to AWS Lambda

AWS S3 Control

  • Features

    • Add 5 APIs to create, update, get, list, delete S3 Storage Lens group(eg. CreateStorageLensGroup), 3 APIs for tagging(TagResource,UntagResource,ListTagsForResource), and update to StorageLensConfiguration to allow metrics to be aggregated on Storage Lens groups.

AWS Systems Manager for SAP

  • Features

    • Update the default value of MaxResult to 50.

Amazon CodeCatalyst

  • Features

    • This release adds functionality for retrieving information about workflows and workflow runs and starting workflow runs in Amazon CodeCatalyst.

Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud

  • Features

    • AWS EBS now supports Snapshot Lock, giving users the ability to lock an EBS Snapshot to prohibit deletion of the snapshot. This release introduces the LockSnapshot, UnlockSnapshot & DescribeLockedSnapshots APIs to manage lock configuration for snapshots. The release also includes the dl2q_24xlarge.

Amazon Redshift

  • Features

    • The custom domain name SDK for Amazon Redshift provisioned clusters is updated with additional required parameters for modify and delete operations. Additionally, users can provide domain names with longer top-level domains.

Amazon Relational Database Service

  • Features

    • Updates Amazon RDS documentation for support for upgrading RDS for MySQL snapshots from version 5.7 to version 8.0.

AmazonMWAA

  • Features

    • This Amazon MWAA release adds support for customer-managed VPC endpoints. This lets you choose whether to create, and manage your environment's VPC endpoints, or to have Amazon MWAA create, and manage them for you.

Auto Scaling

  • Features

    • This release introduces Instance Maintenance Policy, a new EC2 Auto Scaling capability that allows customers to define whether instances are launched before or after existing instances are terminated during instance replacement operations.

FinSpace Public API

  • Features

    • Adding deprecated trait to APIs in this name space.

FinSpace User Environment Management service

  • Features

    • Adding deprecated trait on Dataset Browser Environment APIs

  • 6cb6066 Update GitHub version number to 1.12.590-SNAPSHOT

1.12.589 2023-11-14

AWS Backup

  • Features

    • AWS Backup - Features: Provide Job Summary for your backup activity.

AWS Clean Rooms Service

  • Features

    • This feature provides the ability for the collaboration creator to configure either the member who can run queries or a different member in the collaboration to be billed for query compute costs.

AWS Glue

  • Features

    • Introduces new storage optimization APIs to support automatic compaction of Apache Iceberg tables.

AWS IoT

  • Features

    • This release introduces new attributes in API CreateSecurityProfile, UpdateSecurityProfile and DescribeSecurityProfile to support management of Metrics Export for AWS IoT Device Defender Detect.

AWS Lambda

  • Features

    • Add Python 3.12 (python3.12) support to AWS Lambda

AWS MediaTailor

  • Features

    • Removed unnecessary default values.

AWS Resource Explorer

  • Features

    • Resource Explorer supports multi-account search. You can now use Resource Explorer to search and discover resources across AWS accounts within your organization or organizational unit.

AWS Signer

  • Features

    • Documentation updates for AWS Signer

AWS Step Functions

  • Features

    • This release adds support to redrive executions in AWS Step Functions with a new RedriveExecution operation.

Amazon Connect Service

  • Features

    • Introducing SegmentAttributes parameter for StartChatContact API

Amazon EventBridge Pipes

  • Features

    • Added support (via new LogConfiguration field in CreatePipe and UpdatePipe APIs) for logging to Amazon CloudWatch Logs, Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3), and Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose

Amazon SageMaker Service

  • Features

    • This release makes Model Registry Inference Specification fields as not required.

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>mixpanel/mixpanel-js (mixpanel-browser)</summary>

### [`v2.48.1`](https://togithub.com/mixpanel/mixpanel-js/releases/tag/v2.48.1): Minification fix for UTM campaign properties

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/mixpanel/mixpanel-js/compare/v2.48.0...v2.48.1)

This update patches a discrepancy between the minified and unminified versions of the packaged SDK. Campaign parameters will now be stored as super properties persistently in all versions.

### [`v2.48.0`](https://togithub.com/mixpanel/mixpanel-js/releases/tag/v2.48.0): Configurable API endpoints, miscellaneous updates and fixes

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/mixpanel/mixpanel-js/compare/v2.47.0...v2.48.0)

API endpoint routes can now be configured individually, so you can rename /track, /engage, and /groups HTTP endpoints arbitrarily. Configure with the `api_routes` option:

```js
mixpanel.init(`my token`, {
  api_host: `https://my-proxy.example.com`,
  api_routes: {
    track: `foo/`,
    engage: `bar/`,
    groups: `baz/`,
  },
));
```

In the above example, event-tracking requests will go to `https://my-proxy.example.com/foo/`, user profile updates to `https://my-proxy.example.com/bar/`, etc.

Other fixes:

-   Event properties object passed to `mixpanel.track()` will no longer be mutated
-   Super properties are now reloaded from persistence when making every tracking call (i.e., kept fresh when another tab/window in the same browser has updated them)
-   Extra failsafe behavior for trying to clear queued requests when localStorage doesn't work on startup, e.g., when localStorage is full so writes fail
-   Block Chrome-Lighthouse user agent
-   Fix for error in `add_group()` when adding a new group to an existing list

</details>

### [`v8.3.1`](https://togithub.com/camunda-community-hub/zeebe-client-node-js/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#831)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/camunda-community-hub/zeebe-client-node-js/compare/8.3.0...8.3.1)

#### New Features

*New shiny stuff*

-   You can now deploy forms to the Zeebe broker using `ZBClient.deployResource()`. See [#​332](https://togithub.com/camunda-community-hub/zeebe-client-node-js/issues/332) for more details.

### [`v8.3.0`](https://togithub.com/camunda-community-hub/zeebe-client-node-js/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#830)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/camunda-community-hub/zeebe-client-node-js/compare/8.2.5...8.3.0)

#### Breaking changes

*Changes in APIs or behaviour that may affect existing applications that use zeebe-node.*

-   Several method signatures for `CreateProcessInstance` and `CreateProcessInstanceWithResult` have been removed, leaving only the method that takes an object parameter. See [#​330](https://togithub.com/camunda-community-hub/zeebe-client-node-js/issues/330#issuecomment-1672535320) for more details.

#### Known Issues

*Things that don't work or don't work as expected, and which will be addressed in a future release*

-   The `onConnectionError` event fires correctly for Camunda SaaS, but fires a false positive when connecting to a Self-Managed instance. See [#​340](https://togithub.com/camunda-community-hub/zeebe-client-node-js/issues/340) for more details.

#### New Features

*New shiny stuff.*

-   Camunda Platform 8.3.0 introduces multi-tenancy. To support this, the Node.js client adds an optional `tenantId` parameter to `DeployResource`, `DeployProcess`, `CreateProcessInstance`, `CreateProcessInstanceWithResult`, and `PublishMessage`. You can also specify a `tenantId` in the ZBClient constructor or via the environment variable `ZEEBE_TENANT_ID`. In the case that you specify it via the environment or constructor, it will be transparently added to all method invocations. See [#​330](https://togithub.com/camunda-community-hub/zeebe-client-node-js/issues/330) for more details.
-   `@grpc/grpc-js` has been updated to 1.9.7, and `@grpc/proto-loader` has been updated to 0.7.10.

*Things that were broken and are now fixed.*

-   The `onReady` and `onConnection` event tests now pass, so these events should be usable. See [#​215](https://togithub.com/camunda-community-hub/zeebe-client-node-js/issues/215) for more details.

#### Fixes

*Things that were broken and are now fixed.*

-   An error message "Grpc Stream Error: 16 UNAUTHENTICATED: Failed to parse bearer token, see cause for details" would be logged intermittently. This was because under particular conditions an expired token cached on disk could be used for API calls. To prevent this, the disk-cached token is evicted at the same time as the in-memory token. See [#​336](https://togithub.com/camunda-community-hub/zeebe-client-node-js/issues/336) for more details.
-   The `onReady` and `onConnection` event tests now pass for Camunda SaaS. The `onReady` event fires correctly for Self-Managed started with docker-compose. See [#​215](https://togithub.com/camunda-community-hub/zeebe-client-node-js/issues/215) and [#​340](https://togithub.com/camunda-community-hub/zeebe-client-node-js/issues/340) for more details.

</details>

gitHubText:
Bumps [com.amazonaws:aws-java-sdk-sts](https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-java) from 1.12.583 to 1.12.587.
Changelog

Sourced from com.amazonaws:aws-java-sdk-sts's changelog.

1.12.587 2023-11-10

AWS Control Tower

  • Features

    • AWS Control Tower supports tagging for enabled controls. This release introduces TagResource, UntagResource and ListTagsForResource APIs to manage tags in existing enabled controls. It updates EnabledControl API to tag resources at creation time.

AWS Cost and Usage Report Service

  • Features

    • This release adds support for tagging and customers can now tag report definitions. Additionally, ReportStatus is now added to report definition to show when the last delivered time stamp and if it succeeded or not.

AWS Elemental MediaConvert

  • Features

    • This release includes the ability to specify any input source as the primary input for corresponding follow modes, and allows users to specify fit and fill behaviors without resizing content.

AWS Marketplace Entitlement Service

  • Features

    • Add paginators to GetEntitlements.

Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud

  • Features

    • EC2 adds API updates to enable ENA Express at instance launch time.

Amazon Relational Database Service

  • Features

    • Updates Amazon RDS documentation for zero-ETL integrations.

Firewall Management Service

  • Features

    • Adds optimizeUnassociatedWebACL flag to ManagedServiceData, updates third-party firewall examples, and other minor documentation updates.

1.12.586 2023-11-09

AWS CloudFormation

  • Features

    • Added new ConcurrencyMode feature for AWS CloudFormation StackSets for faster deployments to target accounts.

AWS CloudTrail

  • Features

    • The Insights in Lake feature lets customers enable CloudTrail Insights on a source CloudTrail Lake event data store and create a destination event data store to collect Insights events based on unusual management event activity in the source event data store.

AWS Lambda

  • Features

    • Add Custom runtime on Amazon Linux 2023 (provided.al2023) support to AWS Lambda.

Amazon CloudWatch Logs

  • Features

    • Update to support new APIs for delivery of logs from AWS services.

Amazon Comprehend

  • Features

    • This release adds support for toxicity detection and prompt safety classification.

... (truncated)

Closes #3787 

Bumping ES Version to support ES 8.9+

I had to change the ElasticSearchConnector to add a new Bean, following the instructions from here: https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/36669.

Spring boot 3.1 isn't compatible with ES java client 8.9, so they proposed a workaround.

Other than that, I just updated ES versions everywhere.

gitHubText:
<!-- Please link the related GitHub issue here -->

Closes #3773 

## Description

<!-- Please explain the changes you made here. -->
Update search task API to fetch Task variables:
* After querying for tasks, using `VariableService.getVariablesPerTaskId(List<GetVariablesRequest>)` to fetch tasks' variables, matching the `includeVariables` in the search request 
* Runtime variables are fetched for `CREATED` tasks
* Task variables (variables snapshot on task completion) are fetched for `COMPLETED` tasks
* Draft variables are not fetched

gitHubText:
<!-- Please link the related GitHub issue here -->

Closes #3709 
Closes #3712 
## Description

<!-- Please explain the changes you made here. -->
on Delete Process definition event, delete process definition related objects in Tasklist
  - Tasks on partition provided in Zeebe record
  - TaskVariables on partition provided in Zeebe record
  - Process entity
  - Embedded forms

I did not include ProcessInstances (as was presented in kickoff) as they don't refer to the process definition id. But there are deleted anyway with Archiving job along with FlowNodeInstances and runtime Variables

There is another possible approach to implement this. Instead of handle the deletion by the importer, we can:
- mark a process definition for deletion by the importer (isDeleted flag on process entity)
- use the archiver to delete the related objects

Pros:
- does not block the importer in case of high number of objects to delete
- Separation of concerns (importer just import Zeebe records without any logic)

Cons:
- we need to filter out everywhere the process entities with isDeleted flag (unless we consider the archive frequency is good enough and we can live with few seconds of inconsistency)

@marcosgvieira @nathansandi I hesitated between the two approaches, I still don't have enough perspective to assess the impact of a process deletion with thousands of tasks and if this can slow down the importer

## Test cases:

- [ ] [When highest version of process is deleted from Operate the one below is displayed in tasklist](https://camunda.testrail.com/index.php?/cases/view/183835)
- [ ] [When intermediate version is deleted in Operate this version should be deleted in tasklist](https://camunda.testrail.com/index.php?/cases/view/183836&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&display_deleted_cases=0&group_id=2443)
- [ ] [When all versions of process are deleted from Operate process should be deleted in tasklist](https://camunda.testrail.com/index.php?/cases/view/183837)
- [ ] [Process defenition deletion reflects in Tasklist with Multitenancy enabled](https://camunda.testrail.com/index.php?/cases/view/184937)

 nathansandi: > @marcosgvieira @nathansandi I hesitated between the two approaches, I still don't have enough perspective to assess the impact of a process deletion with thousands of tasks and if this can slow down the importer

Hello @houssain-barouni, are the tasks deleted on Zeebe, once we have the process deletion (with event)? If yes, but you are concerning about the importers, what I would suggest, if this may affect the behaviour over the **importers**, we also can apply the deletion of the tasks in the same way as you are deleting data inside our indexes. 

However, usually gRPC events are supposed to have fast process over the events and in theory should not be a problem. Considering as well as the user case of the Process deletion (more dev, as we discussed on kick-off), maybe delete over the importer will not be a problem if Zeebe send the event for Job/Task too. What do you think?

(I understand also that this can be done separated in another PR)
 houssain-barouni: > > @marcosgvieira @nathansandi I hesitated between the two approaches, I still don't have enough perspective to assess the impact of a process deletion with thousands of tasks and if this can slow down the importer
> 
> Hello @houssain-barouni, are the tasks deleted on Zeebe, once we have the process deletion (with event)? If yes, but you are concerning about the importers, what I would suggest, if this may affect the behaviour over the **importers**, we also can apply the deletion of the tasks in the same way as you are deleting data inside our indexes.
> 
> However, usually gRPC events are supposed to have fast process over the events and in theory should not be a problem. Considering as well as the user case of the Process deletion (more dev, as we discussed on kick-off), maybe delete over the importer will not be a problem if Zeebe send the event for Job/Task too. What do you think?
> 
> (I understand also that this can be done separated in another PR)

Thank you @nathansandi for these insights. I already posted this question in [ask-zeebe](https://camunda.slack.com/archives/CSQ2E3BT4/p1698768046424059). Unfortunately, on process def deletion, we will not receive any Task delete events as the tasks are removed from runtime state as soon they are completed or terminated. Meaning they already don't exist in Zeebe when the process definition is deleted from Zeebe. So we will receive only one event (or to be more precise, one event per zeebe partition) about process definition deletion and nothing else.
 esraagamal6: @houssain-barouni Can you please review the test cases taking into consideration that it would be executed for both ES and OS?
 houssain-barouni: > @houssain-barouni Can you please review the test cases taking into consideration that it would be executed for both ES and OS?

I don't have access to TestRail, I opened a ticket to Helpdesk. I will review them once it is done
 houssain-barouni: > @houssain-barouni Can you please review the test cases taking into consideration that it would be executed for both ES and OS?

@esraagamal6 LGTM
* you can add extra checks about Completed tasks being deleted for respective deleted process definition (when you delete V2 process def, Tasks related to V2 process def are deleted in Tasklist)
* in one scenario try to wait more than 1 hour after task completion before deleting the process. One hour is the time required for a completed task to be archived. The archived task should be deleted as well.
 esraagamal6: Testing updates:

- Completed tasks are removed from Tasklist completed panel when it is deleted via `zbctl delete resoource` but when it is deleted from Operate UI the completed tasks remains in the completed tasks panel in Tasklist -> @houssain-barouni  is investigating this
- **Some** processes could be deleted via `zbctl delete resoource`  although it has running instances and in this case those running instances remains in Tasklist but the task details data is never retrieved in Tasklist UI `
404 Not Found` , but this should not be a blocker because this should be handled in Zeebe team in this [ticket](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/issues/15221)
 houssain-barouni: > Testing updates:
> 
> * Completed tasks are removed from Tasklist completed panel when it is deleted via `zbctl delete resoource` but when it is deleted from Operate UI the completed tasks remains in the completed tasks panel in Tasklist -> @houssain-barouni  is investigating this
> * **Some** processes could be deleted via `zbctl delete resoource`  although it has running instances and in this case those running instances remains in Tasklist but the task details data is never retrieved in Tasklist UI ` 404 Not Found` , but this should not be a blocker because this should be handled in Zeebe team in this [ticket](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/issues/15221)

@esraagamal6 
I have reproduced the issue:
- Zeebe is configured with 2 partitions
- Some tasks are created on partition 1 , others on partition 2 (depends where the process instance is started)
- When the process is deleted , Zeebe notifies tasklist with partitionId=1 (It is expected to receive notifications for all partitions about process deletion)
- We delete only tasks on partition 1

I will check with Zeebe team, why notification is sent only for one partition

**Update:** Actually we are receiving the event for both partitions, I will check why the partition 2 event was skipped

**Update 2:** I confirm that for PROCESS records we handle the events for one single partition https://github.com/camunda/tasklist/blob/89f0ea75f7835485ffae79184cf34e5d2c3a5ccf/importer/src/main/java/io/camunda/tasklist/zeebeimport/RecordsReaderHolder.java#L54-L55
I will remove the filtering on `partitionId` for the deletion
 esraagamal6: Testing updates:
When process  has more than 10 instances to be deleted some of them are displayed in tasklist after deletion on openSearch
 houssain-barouni: > Testing updates: When process has more than 10 instances to be deleted some of them are displayed in tasklist after deletion on openSearch

@esraagamal6 
Scrolling in Opensearch was broken (it affects also master), we were fetching only 10 first results only. I have fixed it.
Example of usecase affected by broken opensearch scrolling in master:
- Create 11 tasks having a variable varA=foo
- Do a search task query with varA=foo
- You will notice that only 10 tasks are returned instead of 11
 esraagamal6: @houssain-barouni Tested OK

[test-results]:data:application/gzip;base64,H4sIAKeVU2UC/02MQQ6DIBQFr2JYdwHCF+hljCgkpCoNwsr07v0YFZczL2924vxsN/JutHg1ZMs+VZpyHJIPKzJAx9DgmMosFL2o3/I4FtXpqj7+i4rdl94NfkZTXzbGEE8T81qiQMUJd1Oz2zySh3gUD76CLYoxLItPCAS4dkJyo4CqlonJWjDGgZTOGJiU5Bp4J6Uivz+eJbnUCgEAAA== :recycle: This comment has been updated with latest results. marcosgvieira: @nathansandi Is this still a draft or is it ready to review? nathansandi: Hi @marcosgvieira I just moved to review It was a draft, in the time I open because I was trying to reproduce the error (but could not for tasks), but at the same time I think its a gain to put this in PROD to prevent bugs related to nullable fields on JSON. marcosgvieira: @nathansandi, just for my understanding what happens when the `return objectMapper.readValue(variable.getValue(), Object.class);` against the "null" value that causes the error? nathansandi: > @nathansandi, just for my understanding what happens when the `return objectMapper.readValue(variable.getValue(), Object.class);` against the "null" value that causes the error? Similar to Start Process by a form (PS: Maybe this was already threaten over forms for Tasks), when calling objectMapper.readValue(variable.getValue(), Object.class);, Jackson (the underlying library used by objectMapper) attempts to deserialize the JSON string in variable.getValue() into a Java object of type Object. The problem arises when the JSON string represents the literal string "null" rather than the JSON null value. In JSON, the value null is a special keyword indicating the absence of a value or a null value. It's not represented as a string, but as the literal null. For example: ``` { "someKey": null } ``` In contrast, if you have a string "null" in your JSON, it is treated as a regular string and not a null value: ``` { "someKey": "null" } ``` So, when you attempt to deserialize the string "null" into an Object using objectMapper.readValue(variable.getValue(), Object.class);, Jackson tries to parse it as a regular string, not as the special null value, resulting in the actual string "null" being returned. To handle this situation, I've added a check: ``` if (variable.getValue().equals("null")) { return "null"; // JSON Object null must be instanced like "null", also should not send to // objectMapper null values } ``` This check ensures that if the variable.getValue() is the string "null," you return the string "null" instead of trying to deserialize it using Jackson. This way, you're preserving the original intent of the "null" string in your JSON data. marcosgvieira: > So, when you attempt to deserialize the string "null" into an Object using objectMapper.readValue(variable.getValue(), Object.class);, Jackson tries to parse it as a regular string, not as the special null value, resulting in the actual string "null" being returned. So isn't it the same result as the new condition we are adding? nathansandi: > So isn't it the same result as the new condition we are adding? Yes, In such a case, you explicitly return the string "null" without attempting to deserialize it using objectMapper. The problem would be if go to Object mapper with the "null" value This code is handling both the case where the input is the string "null" and the case where it's a valid JSON string. The added condition ensures that you handle the special case of the string "null" without attempting unnecessary deserialization. The error was caused when goes to Object Mapper, trying to serialize the null json value marcosgvieira: > e the input is the string "null" and the case where it's a valid JSON string. The added condition ensures that you handle the special case of the string "null" without attempting unnecessary deserialization. The error was caused when goes to Object Mapper, trying to serialize the null json value Then if the result is the same I don't think we are fixing any error as the behavior is the same (also we are adding a condition to all the cases to try to avoid a deserialization in a case that doesn't happen so often) - should we really add this condition? The #3585 also cannot be closed by this PR as it's covered in another task by @houssain-barouni can you check if you referenced the right ticket? marcosgvieira: After a chat with @nathansandi he explained that when passing "null" to the objectMapper a NullPointer is throwed, so this is the reason for the condition. github-actions[bot]: Successfully created backport PR for `stable/8.3`: - #3810 github-actions[bot]: Successfully created backport PR for `stable/8.2`: - #3811

<details>
<summary>vitejs/vite-plugin-react (@​vitejs/plugin-react)</summary>

### [`v4.2.1`](https://togithub.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react/blob/HEAD/packages/plugin-react/CHANGELOG.md#421-2023-12-04)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react/compare/v4.2.0...v4.2.1)

Remove generic parameter on `Plugin` to avoid type error with Rollup 4/Vite 5 and `skipLibCheck: false`.

I expect very few people to currently use this feature, but if you are extending the React plugin via `api` object, you can get back the typing of the hook by importing `ViteReactPluginApi`:

```ts
import type { Plugin } from 'vite'
import type { ViteReactPluginApi } from '@​vitejs/plugin-react'

export const somePlugin: Plugin = {
  name: 'some-plugin',
  api: {
    reactBabel: (babelConfig) => {
      babelConfig.plugins.push('some-babel-plugin')
    },
  } satisfies ViteReactPluginApi,
}
```

</details>

title: chore: fix lint

gitHubText:
Closes #3430 Closes #https://github.com/camunda/tasklist/issues/3892 ## Description Main focus of this PR is to test the integration for multi-tenancy uscases which requires: - Zeebe with identity ON and MT ON - Identity with MT ON - Keycloak 2 tests (only) were created , as most of MT tests are covered in unit tests. Here we are mainly making sure that the interaction between components is working: - deploying a process in Zeebe for a tenant requires an authenticated gRPC call - Importers are getting the objects with their tenants and storing the tenantId in DB (Test checkers are using a "Tenant Aware" context to verify if the deployment was propagated to Tasklist) - Tasklist should take into account the tenants being set in the context to allow/filter/disallow some actions on tenant aware objects ## Definition of Done _Not all items need to be done depending on the issue and the pull request._ - [ ] All acceptance criteria described in the issue are met Testing: - [ ] Unit/integration tests are written, that verify all acceptance criteria of the issue - [ ] E2E tests are written, if the acceptance criteria can't be covered in unit/integration tests - [ ] The fix/feature is tested manually by the author Documentation: - [ ] If documentation needs to be updated, an issue is created in the [camunda-platform-docs](https://github.com/camunda/camunda-platform-docs) repo, and the issue is added to our Operate/Tasklist project board. ## Definition of Reviewed - [ ] All acceptance criteria described in the issue are met - [ ] Unit/integration tests are written, that verify all acceptance criteria of the issue - [ ] E2E tests are written, if the acceptance criteria can't be covered in unit/integration tests - ## Description

<!-- Please explain the changes you made here. -->

## Definition of Done

<!-- As author please check the items that apply before requesting a review. -->

_Not all items need to be done depending on the issue and the pull request._

- [ ] All acceptance criteria described in the issue are met

Testing:

- [ ] Unit/integration tests are written, that verify all acceptance criteria of the issue
- [ ] E2E tests are written, if the acceptance criteria can't be covered in unit/integration tests
- [ ] The fix/feature is tested manually by the author

Documentation:

- [ ] If documentation needs to be updated, an issue is created in the [camunda-platform-docs](https://github.com/camunda/camunda-platform-docs) repo, and the issue is added to our Operate/Tasklist project board.

## Definition of Reviewed

<!-- As a reviewer please check the items that apply before approving this PR -->

- [ ] All acceptance criteria described in the issue are met
- [ ] Unit/integration tests are written, that verify all acceptance criteria of the issue
- [ ] E2E tests are written, if the acceptance criteria can't be covered in unit/integration tests
- [ ] The fix/feature is tested manually by the reviewer

jib-maven-plugin v3.4.0

Major Changes

deps: bump org.apache.maven:maven-compat from 3.9.1 to 3.9.2. (GoogleContainerTools/jib#4017) deps: bump com.github.luben:zstd-jni from 1.5.5-2 to 1.5.5-4. (GoogleContainerTools/jib#4049) deps: bump com.fasterxml.jackson:jackson-bom from 2.15.0 to 2.15.2. (GoogleContainerTools/jib#4055) deps: bump com.google.guava:guava from 32.0.1-jre to 32.1.2-jre (GoogleContainerTools/jib#4078) deps: bump org.slf4j:slf4j-simple from 2.0.7 to 2.0.9. (GoogleContainerTools/jib#4098) fix: fix WWW-Authenticate header parsing for Basic authentication (GoogleContainerTools/jib#4035)

See CHANGELOG.md for more details.

jib-gradle-plugin v3.4.0

3.4.0

Major Changes

  • feat: support gradle lazy configuration for entrypoint container parameter. (#4003)
  • deps: bump com.github.luben:zstd-jni from 1.5.5-2 to 1.5.5-4. (#4049)
  • deps: bump com.fasterxml.jackson:jackson-bom from 2.15.0 to 2.15.2. (#4055)
  • deps: bump com.google.guava:guava from 32.0.1-jre to 32.1.2-jre (#4078)
  • deps: bump org.slf4j:slf4j-simple from 2.0.7 to 2.0.9. (#4098)
  • fix: fix WWW-Authenticate header parsing for Basic authentication (#4035)
  • Fixed Gradle deprecations for Gradle 8.2. (#3892)

See CHANGELOG.md for more details.

jib-maven-plugin v3.3.2

Major Changes

  • Log an info instead of warning when entrypoint makes the image to ignore jvm parameters (GoogleContainerTools/jib#3904)

See CHANGELOG.md for more details.

jib-gradle-plugin v3.3.2

Major Changes

  • Support lazy configuration for jib.container.mainClass and jib.container.jvmFlags parameters (GoogleContainerTools/jib#3936)
  • Log an info instead of warning when entrypoint makes the image to ignore jvm parameters (GoogleContainerTools/jib#3904)

See CHANGELOG.md for more details.

Closes #3753

## Description

<!-- Please explain the changes you made here. -->
without the override, good netty version is used
```
[INFO] io.camunda:tasklist-webapp:jar:8.4.0-SNAPSHOT
[INFO] \- io.camunda:zeebe-client-java:jar:8.4.0-alpha1:compile
[INFO]    \- io.grpc:grpc-netty:jar:1.59.0:compile
[INFO]       \- io.netty:netty-codec-http2:jar:4.1.100.Final:compile
```

Zeebe is overriding `netty` to `4.1.100.Final` in [8.1](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/blob/8.1.20/parent/pom.xml#L70) , [8.2](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/blame/8.2.18/parent/pom.xml#L73), [8.3](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/blob/8.3.3/parent/pom.xml#L73) and [master](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/blob/8.4.0-alpha1/parent/pom.xml#L73)

#####    🚨 Breaking Changes

-   **coverage**: glob based coverage thresholds by [@​AriPerkkio](https://togithub.com/AriPerkkio) in [https://github.com/vitest-dev/vitest/pull/4442](https://togithub.com/vitest-dev/vitest/pull/4442) [<samp>(18300)</samp>](https://togithub.com/vitest-dev/vitest/commit/4953410e8d96bf95f9d92bb2c8413f25b5b371b8)
    -   Refactors coverage thresholds API into new shape and adds support for specifying thresholds for specific files using glob patterns. Moves thresholds related coverage options to `coverage.thresholds`. See [https://github.com/vitest-dev/vitest/pull/4442](https://togithub.com/vitest-dev/vitest/pull/4442) for detailed list of breaking changes

#####    🚀 Features

gitHubText:
Closes # ## Description - if the last character in the shortened branch name is a hyphen (-), it causes an issue with Helm ``` helm template . --name-template tasklist-3773-variables- --namespace tasklist-3773-variables- --kube-version 1.27 --set camunda-platform.tasklist.image.tag=pr-b652c431bede2af723dee6f9afa41609d1aa7796 --set git.branch=3773-variables-in-task-search --set global.labels.app=tasklist-3773-variables- --include-crds` failed exit status 1: Error: release name \"tasklist-3773-variables-\": invalid release name, must match regex ^[a-z0-9]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?(\\.[a-z0-9]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?)*$ and the length must not be longer than 53 ``` - align teardown parameters to the deploy ones ## Definition of Done _Not all items need to be done depending on the issue and the pull request._ - [ ] All acceptance criteria described in the issue are met Testing: - [ ] Unit/integration tests are written, that verify all acceptance criteria of the issue - [ ] E2E tests are written, if the acceptance criteria can't be covered in unit/integration tests - [ ] The fix/feature is tested manually by the author Documentation: - [ ] If documentation needs to be updated, an issue is created in the [camunda-platform-docs](https://github.com/camunda/camunda-platform-docs) repo, and the issue is added to our Operate/Tasklist project board. ## Definition of Reviewed - [ ] All acceptance criteria described in the issue are met - [ ] Unit/integration tests are written, that verify all acceptance criteria of the issue - [ ] E2E tests are written, if the acceptance criteria can't be covered in unit/integration tests - [ ] The fix/feature is tested manually by the reviewer github-actions[bot]: ## Test Results   94 files  +  28    94 suites  +28   1h 49m 16s [:stopwatch:](https://github.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/blob/v2.11.0/README.md#the-symbols "duration of all tests") + 6m 50s 480 tests +162  469 [:heavy_check_mark:](https://github.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/blob/v2.11.0/README.md#the-symbols "passed tests") +156  11 [:zzz:](https://github.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/blob/v2.11.0/README.md#the-symbols "skipped / disabled tests") +6  0 [:x:](https://github.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/blob/v2.11.0/README.md#the-symbols "failed tests") ±0  505 runs  +164  491 [:heavy_check_mark:](https://github.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/blob/v2.11.0/README.md#the-symbols "passed tests") +156  11 [:zzz:](https://github.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/blob/v2.11.0/README.md#the-symbols "skipped / disabled tests") +6  0 [:x:](https://github.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/blob/v2.11.0/README.md#the-symbols "failed tests") ±0  3 [:fire:](https://github.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action/blob/v2.11.0/README.md#the-symbols "test errors") +2  Results for commit 59565456. ± Comparison against base commit 4a39767e.
This pull request removes 72 and adds 234 tests. Note that renamed tests count towards both. ``` io.camunda.tasklist.ProbesTestIT ‑ testIsNotReady io.camunda.tasklist.ProbesTestIT ‑ testIsReady io.camunda.tasklist.es.ElasticsearchConnectorBasicAuthIT ‑ canConnect io.camunda.tasklist.es.ReindexIT ‑ reindexArchivedIndices io.camunda.tasklist.es.ReindexIT ‑ resetIndexSettings io.camunda.tasklist.management.HealthCheckAuthenticationIT ‑ testHealthStateEndpointIsNotSecured io.camunda.tasklist.util.StackdriverJSONLayoutTest ‑ testLayout io.camunda.tasklist.webapp.BackupServiceTest ‑ shouldFailCreateBackupOn1stRequestFailedWithConnectionError io.camunda.tasklist.webapp.BackupServiceTest ‑ shouldFailCreateBackupOn2ndRequestFailedWithConnectionError io.camunda.tasklist.webapp.BackupServiceTest ‑ shouldFailCreateBackupOnBackupIdAlreadyExists … ``` ``` io.camunda.tasklist.ProbesTestElasticSearchIT ‑ Unknown test io.camunda.tasklist.ProbesTestOpenSearchIT ‑ testIsNotReady io.camunda.tasklist.ProbesTestOpenSearchIT ‑ testIsReady io.camunda.tasklist.config.GenerateOpenApiIT ‑ testSwaggerUIIsLoaded io.camunda.tasklist.data.conditionals.DataBaseConditionTest ‑ matches(DataBaseCondition, String, boolean)[10] io.camunda.tasklist.data.conditionals.DataBaseConditionTest ‑ matches(DataBaseCondition, String, boolean)[1] io.camunda.tasklist.data.conditionals.DataBaseConditionTest ‑ matches(DataBaseCondition, String, boolean)[2] io.camunda.tasklist.data.conditionals.DataBaseConditionTest ‑ matches(DataBaseCondition, String, boolean)[3] io.camunda.tasklist.data.conditionals.DataBaseConditionTest ‑ matches(DataBaseCondition, String, boolean)[4] io.camunda.tasklist.data.conditionals.DataBaseConditionTest ‑ matches(DataBaseCondition, String, boolean)[5] … ```
This pull request removes 1 skipped test and adds 7 skipped tests. Note that renamed tests count towards both. ``` io.camunda.tasklist.webapp.es.dao.GenericDAOTest ‑ insertShouldReturnExpectedResponse ``` ``` io.camunda.tasklist.ProbesTestElasticSearchIT ‑ Unknown test io.camunda.tasklist.es.ElasticsearchConnectorBasicAuthIT ‑ Unknown test io.camunda.tasklist.es.ReindexElasticSearchIT ‑ Unknown test io.camunda.tasklist.management.HealthCheckAuthenticationIT ‑ Unknown test io.camunda.tasklist.os.OpenSearchConnectorSSLAuthIT ‑ canConnect io.camunda.tasklist.zeebeimport.ZeebeImportIdempotencyElasticSearchIT ‑ Unknown test io.camunda.tasklist.zeebeimport.ZeebeImportRetryAfterFailureElasticSearchIT ‑ Unknown test ```
[test-results]:data:application/gzip;base64,H4sIAP4eW2UC/03MSw7DIAxF0a1EjDuAghHuZiogIKHmUxEYRd17TZTf8B7Lb2UxDWFhrw7Vo2NLTeWqvmZb0jxRawBNQsfSzsrwo95L9b6Rxos+6UskxCnRpoHk+go5z3mXXKc2Chz2ODdRnHKb3OC2uPUxKAn8PI6pUDBA0KBAG8OfMWoBLnJUXklAlDw60Vsnggvs9wf9/AmfCgEAAA== :recycle: This comment has been updated with latest results. houssain-barouni: zeebe pod is not starting because of: ``` 2023-11-20 04:17:44.743 [Broker-0] [zb-actors-1] [Startup] ERROR io.camunda.zeebe.util.actor - Uncaught exception in 'Startup' in phase 'STARTED'. Continuing with next job. io.camunda.zeebe.journal.JournalException$OutOfDiskSpace: Not enough space to allocate a new journal segment. Required: 2147483648, Available: 1003868160 ``` I am also seeing the same error in some PRs that does not contain these changes like https://github.com/camunda/tasklist/pull/3818 vsgoulart: @houssain-barouni why is it failing now? :sweat_smile: houssain-barouni: > @houssain-barouni why is it failing now? 😅 It is caused by failing zeebe readiness probe ![image](https://github.com/camunda/tasklist/assets/146710021/f87c7a4e-50a6-47cb-a831-fb6a8cd3c266) I will need to investigate it (it is already happening in some other PRs, but never for stage and stable branches)

gitHubText: ## Description This PR introduces a new logging filter to the HTTP requests in the web applicatio n. The filter logs the method, URI, response code, and the time taken to process each request. This enhancement aims to improve logging strategies . **For while the filter will considered just public API (v1), we can make an experiment and extend for another ones** How it will look: ## Definition of Done _Not all items need to be done depending on the issue and the pull request._ - [test-results]:data:application/gzip;base64,H4sIAER6V2UC/02PSw6DIBBAr2JYdwFTQKeXaZRPQqrSIKya3r2jschu3pvMS+bDfJjdxh4dylvHthLyRbakMYe4Equ7VmRomfe1HPifnlsxZlcaL/UKb1JCVOPHMJO5rlxKMZ0mlXWPKg4n1CaKaprkIZriwW3QxGUJmYBNBjQYh4MC9D0K4JL3zhk7TYJe4jSCsAjs+wPK52AtCgEAAA== :recycle: This comment has been updated with latest results. nathansandi: > One thing that I'm wondering is what would be the difference of this logs and the logs provided by the nginx/ingress ([example](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=jsonPayload.path%3D~%22.*%2Fv1%2Ftasks.*%22%0Aresource.labels.namespace_name%3D%22ingress-nginx-blue%22;summaryFields=jsonPayload%252Foutput_fields%252F%2522k8s.ns.name%2522,jsonPayload%252Foutput_fields%252F%2522proc.name%2522,jsonPayload%252Foutput_fields%252F%2522proc.pname%2522,jsonPayload%252Foutput_fields%252F%2522container.image.repository%2522:false:32:beginning;lfeCustomFields=jsonPayload%252Fstatus;cursorTimestamp=2023-11-15T15:48:32.616Z;startTime=2023-11-15T03:48:43.248Z;endTime=2023-11-15T15:48:43.248Z?project=camunda-cloud-240911)), wdyt? @houssain-barouni can you also share your thoughts on this? > > Thanks. NGINX Ingress logs focus on the traffic flowing through the Ingress controller, providing insights into how requests are handled at the Kubernetes Ingress level. Spring log filters, on the other hand, are part of the application's internal logging mechanisms and allow us to customize and extend logging within their Spring-based applications, providing insights into the application-specific behavior. houssain-barouni: > One thing that I'm wondering is what would be the difference of this logs and the logs provided by the nginx/ingress ([example](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=jsonPayload.path%3D~%22.*%2Fv1%2Ftasks.*%22%0Aresource.labels.namespace_name%3D%22ingress-nginx-blue%22;summaryFields=jsonPayload%252Foutput_fields%252F%2522k8s.ns.name%2522,jsonPayload%252Foutput_fields%252F%2522proc.name%2522,jsonPayload%252Foutput_fields%252F%2522proc.pname%2522,jsonPayload%252Foutput_fields%252F%2522container.image.repository%2522:false:32:beginning;lfeCustomFields=jsonPayload%252Fstatus;cursorTimestamp=2023-11-15T15:48:32.616Z;startTime=2023-11-15T03:48:43.248Z;endTime=2023-11-15T15:48:43.248Z?project=camunda-cloud-240911)), wdyt? @houssain-barouni can you also share your thoughts on this? > > Thanks. I think we can deduce similar data from Nginx logs. But I think this is a good idea to add these logs along with application logs for easier correlation with other application-specific logs. I would go even further by adding the log at the beginning and the end of the process and have a sort of correlationId that is used as well for application logs of the same "transaction".

gitHubText:
<!-- Please link the related GitHub issue here -->

Closes #3815 

## Description

<!-- Please explain the changes you made here. -->
Context https://camunda.slack.com/archives/C046XS3GGCR/p1700145911932139
The official C8 Helm Chart relies on very long pod names like 'tasklist-{{branchName}}-elasticsearch-master-{{10 chars hash}}' that should not exceed 63 chars. which leaves 21 chars for branch name. Setting it to 15 like optimize.

## Definition of Done

<!-- As author please check the items that apply before requesting a review. -->

_Not all items need to be done depending on the issue and the pull request._

- [ ] All acceptance criteria described in the issue are met

Testing:

- [ ] Unit/integration tests are written, that verify all acceptance criteria of the issue
- [ ] E2E tests are written, if the acceptance criteria can't be covered in unit/integration tests
- [ ] The fix/feature is tested manually by the author

Documentation:

- [ ] If documentation needs to be updated, an issue is created in the [camunda-platform-docs](https://github.com/camunda/camunda-platform-docs) repo, and the issue is added to our Operate/Tasklist project board.

## Definition of Reviewed

<!-- As a reviewer please check the items that apply before approving this PR -->

- [ ] All acceptance criteria described in the issue are met
- [ ] Unit/integration tests are written, that verify all acceptance criteria of the issue
- [ ] E2E tests are written, if the acceptance criteria can't be covered in unit/integration tests

##### Minor Changes

-   Add `unstable_flushSync` option to `useNavigate`/`useSumbit`/`fetcher.load`/`fetcher.submit` to opt-out of `React.startTransition` and into `ReactDOM.flushSync` for state updates ([#​11005](https://togithub.com/remix-run/react-router/pull/11005))
-   Allow `unstable_usePrompt` to accept a `BlockerFunction` in addition to a `boolean` ([#​10991](https://togithub.com/remix-run/react-router/pull/10991))

##### Patch Changes

-   Fix issue where a changing fetcher `key` in a `useFetcher` that remains mounted wasn't getting picked up ([#​11009](https://togithub.com/remix-run/react-router/pull/11009))
-   Fix `useFormAction` which was incorrectly inheriting the `?index` query param from child route `action` submissions ([#​11025](https://togithub.com/remix-run/react-router/pull/11025))
-   Fix `NavLink` `active` logic when `to` location has a trailing slash ([#​10734](https://togithub.com/remix-run/react-router/pull/10734))
-   Updated dependencies:
    -   `react-router@6.19.0`
    -   `@remix-run/router@1.12.0`

</details>

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>vitejs/vite-plugin-react (@​vitejs/plugin-react)</summary>

### [`v4.2.0`](https://togithub.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react/blob/HEAD/packages/plugin-react/CHANGELOG.md#420-2023-11-16)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react/compare/v4.1.1...v4.2.0)

##### Update peer dependency range to target Vite 5

There were no breaking change that impacted this plugin, so any combination of React plugins and Vite core version will work.

##### Align jsx runtime for optimized dependencies

This will only affect people using internal libraries that contains untranspiled JSX. This change aligns the optimizer with the source code and avoid issues when the published source don't have `React` in the scope.

Reminder: While being partially supported in Vite, publishing TS & JSX outside of internal libraries is highly discouraged.

</details>

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/yarnpkg/yarn/compare/v1.22.20...v1.22.21)

> \[!WARNING]
> This release is missing a couple of artifacts (the .msi/.rpm/.deb/.asc files); we're working on fixing this.

-   Fixes an issue in the v1.22.20 when calling Yarn from a project subfolder, outside of a Corepack context.

-   Added a `SKIP_YARN_COREPACK_CHECK` environment variable to skip the Corepack check.

### [`v1.22.20`](https://togithub.com/yarnpkg/yarn/releases/tag/v1.22.20)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/yarnpkg/yarn/compare/v1.22.19...v1.22.20)

-   **Important:** Punycode is now embed within the bundle, as it has been deprecated by Node.js and will be removed in a future version.

-   A message will be displayed when Yarn 1.22 notices that the local project has a package.json file referencing a non-1.x Yarn release via the `packageManager` field. The message will explain that the project is intended to be used with [Corepack](https://nodejs.org/api/corepack.html).

-   The `yarn-error.log` files won't be generated anymore, as we don't process non-critical 1.x bug reports (we however process all bugs reported on https://github.com/yarnpkg/berry; we just released the 4.0.2 release there).

-   The `yarn set version x.y.z` command will now install the exact `x.y.z` version (prior to this change it used to first install the latest version, and only in a second step would it downgrade to `x.y.z`; this was causing issues when we bump the minimal Node.js version we support, as running `yarn set version 3.6.4` wouldn't work on Node 16).

-   Prevents crashes when reading from an empty `.yarnrc.yml` file.

</details>

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| [mixpanel-browser](https://togithub.com/mixpanel/mixpanel-js) | [`2.47.0` -> `2.48.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/mixpanel-browser/2.47.0/2.48.0) | [![age](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/age/npm/mixpanel-browser/2.48.0?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/adoption/npm/mixpanel-browser/2.48.0?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/compatibility/npm/mixpanel-browser/2.47.0/2.48.0?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/confidence/npm/mixpanel-browser/2.47.0/2.48.0?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>mixpanel/mixpanel-js (mixpanel-browser)</summary>

### [`v2.48.0`](https://togithub.com/mixpanel/mixpanel-js/releases/tag/v2.48.0): Configurable API endpoints, miscellaneous updates and fixes

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/mixpanel/mixpanel-js/compare/v2.47.0...v2.48.0)

API endpoint routes can now be configured individually, so you can rename /track, /engage, and /groups HTTP endpoints arbitrarily. Configure with the `api_routes` option:

```js
mixpanel.init(`my token`, {
  api_host: `https://my-proxy.example.com`,
  api_routes: {
    track: `foo/`,
    engage: `bar/`,
    groups: `baz/`,
  },
));
```

In the above example, event-tracking requests will go to `https://my-proxy.example.com/foo/`, user profile updates to `https://my-proxy.example.com/bar/`, etc.

Other fixes:

-   Event properties object passed to `mixpanel.track()` will no longer be mutated
-   Super properties are now reloaded from persistence when making every tracking call (i.e., kept fresh when another tab/window in the same browser has updated them)
-   Extra failsafe behavior for trying to clear queued requests when localStorage doesn't work on startup, e.g., when localStorage is full so writes fail
-   Block Chrome-Lighthouse user agent
-   Fix for error in `add_group()` when adding a new group to an existing list

</details>

camunda/camunda-platform-helm (camunda-platform) ### [`v8.3.2`](https://togithub.com/camunda/camunda-platform-helm/releases/tag/camunda-platform-8.3.2) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/camunda/camunda-platform-helm/compare/camunda-platform-8.3.1...camunda-platform-8.3.2) The changelog is automatically generated using [git-chglog](https://togithub.com/git-chglog/git-chglog) and it follows [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) format. #### [camunda-platform-8.3.2](https://togithub.com/camunda/camunda-platform-helm/compare/camunda-platform-8.3.1...camunda-platform-8.3.2) (2023-11-13) ##### Fix - loads env vars for external database when external database is enabled ([#​1029](https://togithub.com/camunda/camunda-platform-helm/issues/1029)) - optimize to use consistent versioning with other 8.3 components ([#​1014](https://togithub.com/camunda/camunda-platform-helm/issues/1014)) - set the correct name for zeebe pvcStorageClassName - fixes serviceMonitors for identity, connectors, and modeler ##### Refactor - add volume mounts for optimize migration init container ([#​1037](https://togithub.com/camunda/camunda-platform-helm/issues/1037))

title: chore(deps): update typescript-eslint monorepo to v6.11.0

gitHubText:
## Description
 
This PR updates the versions of various dependenci es used in the project. The updates include maven-reso urces-plug in, micrometer , byte.buddy , zeebe-test -container , json, and others.
 
client/pom .xml: Updated the version of maven-reso urces-plug in from 2.6 to 3.3.1. 
pom.xml: Multiple dependency versions have been updated, including micrometer (from 1.10.5 to 1.11.5), byte.buddy (from 1.14.4 to 1.14.9), zeebe-test -container (from 3.5.2 to 3.6.0), json (from 20230618 to 20231013), and maven-reso urces-plug in (from 3.3.0 to 3.3.1).

## Definition of Done

<!-- As author please check the items that apply before requesting a review. -->

_Not all items need to be done depending on the issue and the pull request._

- [ ] All acceptance criteria described in the issue are met

Testing:

- [ ] Unit/integration tests are written, that verify all acceptance criteria of the issue
- [ ] E2E tests are written, if the acceptance criteria can't be covered in unit/integration tests
- [ ] The fix/feature is tested manually by the author

Documentation:

- [ ] If documentation needs to be updated, an issue is created in the [camunda-platform-docs](https://github.com/camunda/camunda-platform-docs) repo, and the issue is added to our Operate/Tasklist project board.

## Definition of Reviewed

<!-- As a reviewer please check the items that apply before approving this PR -->

- [ ] All acceptance criteria described in the issue are met
- [ ] Unit/integration tests are written, that verify all acceptance criteria of the issue
- [ ] E2E tests are written, if the acceptance criteria can't be covered in unit/integration tests
- [ ] The fix/feature is tested manually by the reviewer
